website_summaries.verdict: A premium pet clipper. Designed to effortlessly glide through heavy coats.
pros: 2 speed settings for heavier coats and general grooming
cons: may be bulky for smaller hands
Additional attachments sold separately and may be tricky to change at first

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - get a second blade
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Haircut #1 completed. Ok - so she's got to be a little embarrassed about her home haircut, but I'm learning! These were super easy to use on our labradoodle who had gotten so out of control with long, curly, tangled hair, I thought the groomer might turn us away. I thought I'd save the $90 haircut and give this a go on the bet that we could start doing ourselves and have these paid for in only two haircuts (even with an extra blade)! I took advice on reviews and got a sectional blade to switch out when one gets hot. Works like a charm. Highly recommend. Before and after pics attached!
customer_reviews.author: Kim S.

customer_reviews.title: The 2 speeds helps with more difficult areas like around joints
customer_reviews.text: I have a poodle mix that requires frequent grooming. After watching Youtube videos I decided to try to do it myself. I first tried a cheaper clipper but it was very difficult to get an even cut. The Andis ProClip glides much smoother thought her fur. The 2 speeds helps with more difficult areas like around joints.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Buy these clippers!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Maltese that was a matted mess. These clippers worked great. Other reviews noted blades getting really hot but we did not have that trouble. There are 2 speeds- low and high. Low speed was adequate for most of the cut. We had looked at several reviews and different brands/models at our local pet store. The price on Amazon was significantly lower.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D.

customer_reviews.title: I got one front leg and her neck shaved and no more. It's going back
customer_reviews.text: I spent what I thought was good money for a higher-end clipper. It was about the cost to groom a large dog like mine. However, I didn't even get one full shaving of my dog. I didn't even get half a shaving. I didn't EVEN manage to shave 25% of my dog before it just quit cutting. So now my dog looks like a freak and I have to find a professional groomer anyway. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Lauri S

customer_reviews.title: Runs way too hot!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have groomed my standard poodle for 10 years using an Oster clipper but recently opted to purchase this item after reading reviews. Big mistake. If you groom a standard poodle do not buy this. After 5 minutes the blades and barrel of this thing gets ridiculously hot. Fortunately I still have the Oster so I switch between the 2 but either this Andis is not what it is advertised to be or I have a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: David Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Buy this
customer_reviews.text: This has helped me to give my mini poodle a decent cut at home. With cheaper shaver it just doesn't cut as cleanly. I mostly cut his hair with this and then use cheaper scissor set (25$) to finish. I use 10 for his bald summer body look and FC-5 for slightly longer cut or to even out some edges.
customer_reviews.author: C.W.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after the fourth use! Before that, it worked great, but it suddenly wouldn't cut the dog's anymore. We took it apart and got all the hair out of it, put it back together, still nothing. There's no reasonable explanation for it to no longer work. We bought this in February, it's now May. It only worked for two months! (Our dog is a HOT dog. We shave him every 2-3 weeks.) This would have been amazing had it continued to work. Instead, we'll be taking him to the groomer's at over $100 per visit. Incredibly disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Bekky

customer_reviews.title: Awful. Too hot to fast!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Blade gets hot WAY TOO FAST. Clipper is bulky and loud. I was waiting for my dog grooming van to be finished so the clippers sat in the box for about two months. Complete disappointment. Front panel falls off day one. It was one of the first items i bought and the last i use. I bought the little 2 detachable blade pink Andis, which I loved, but now that one is too loud and sounds like its going to blow up. My Wahl cordless ARCO is 100xs a better clipper in every! Wish I could return the 2 Andis clippers I have!!!
customer_reviews.author: terri Skipper

customer_reviews.title: It works for thick coats ! DIY
customer_reviews.text: I have a Coton de tulear and I love saving money with this thing! This is a great price and really cuts well on clean and brushed coats when you use the different size clips . If you need to completely shave it also works great. However !! No matter how good the clippers and expensive they are they all get hot at some point so always make sure to stop and check especially if your shaving off all hair on your pet so you don’t burn your pet. Definitely happy with this
customer_reviews.author: Sandy*B

customer_reviews.title: Andis Ultra Edge 2 Speed AGC 2
customer_reviews.text: These clippers are great for my golden doodle. Very smooth and not noisy. I was worried about how loud they would be, but my boy was not afraid. They do feel a little heavy while using it for a while, but it’s fine. I think these clippers worked very well. Hopefully, they will last a long time
customer_reviews.author: evie

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick coats
customer_reviews.text: Do not believe the fake reviews below. We have an a Hanavnese whose coat is reasonably think (by no means as thick as some other breeds) and these clipper did not work AT ALL. I even spent the extra thirty bucks on the special blade for heavy coats and it was a JOKE. We ended up using scissors which work 10x faster than these clippers. No idea how they can get away saying these work on thick coats. It just ain't true. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Levi45

customer_reviews.title: Best Clippers I've Ever Used-Hands Down
customer_reviews.text: Amazing clippers and well worth the price. I have 4 dogs, only 3 need groomed regularly. Local shop-$50 a pop and a goofy bandana. These are the clippers the pros use and they have paid for themselves 3 times over already. My pooches may not be ready for the red carpet but they stay cool in the summer and all that fur isn't floating around everywhere. They do get a little warm during use, which is expected when metal vibrates on metal but as long as you're continuously moving them (you know, actually clipping the pet) then you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Great clippers for a decent price. I’m not a professional groomer but I groom two dogs every 2 weeks and this has been doing a wonderful job keeping up. No complaints other than the silver clip to hang the clippers by broke off the first say, I didn’t plan to hang them from the wall always so it wasn’t an issue for me. The two speed does a pretty good job getting through what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kacy Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great Mid Priced Clippers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my daughter who is trying to start a small grooming business. Being a former dog handler I was already familiar with Andis. Also not knowing how far our daughter was going to take her grooming career we did not want to spend allot, but, still wanted professional grade clippers. The Andis UltraEdge Super 2-Speed (AGC2) has fit the bill nicely. Next step will be the Andis Pulse Zr II 5-Speed.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Jaxxy

customer_reviews.title: We have used it about 2-3x since then and it still works great. Might have to work it in areas that ...
customer_reviews.text: When we finally started using this shaver, it worked really well! We have used it about 2-3x since then and it still works great. Might have to work it in areas that are really matted but otherwise it does the job. We now won't have to pay $150 every time to shave our dog (price included putting dog to sleep). Only problem we have is it overheats. We have to pause and wait for it to cool down. It usually happens about 15-20- mins of continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: Jocyl

customer_reviews.title: Best clippers ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several sets of clippers to shave my Golden Retriever, who has a coat as thick as a bear (exact quote from our vet). This is the only pair that has ever worked. They glide through his thick coat like a knife through warm butter....seriously, that easy!!! I also saved $90-$120 on having him groomed. I don't have to wait as long inbetween having him shaved down as I can do it myself now. The blades to get rather warm. I need to invest in the ceramic blades next. I am thrilled with how well these clippers worked. Myself and Dodge thank you for keeping his hair shaved down in the Louisiana summer heat!!
customer_reviews.author: mschroll

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Worth the cost! I did not have to stop other than to give the blades a little cool down here and there. My little poodle's hair was thick, but these cut with ease. The five other clippers that I have bought between Walmart & Tractor Supply have all bogged down, dulled with first use, overheated, and took me atleast 2 hours to cut my mini-s thick hair. These clippers cut her hair and mats seamlessly. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter, blade easily removed for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I love it, just as I expected I would. The blade gets hot, but that's to be expected. It cuts hair like butter and is quiet. I use metal blade covers for the different lengths and that keeps the hot blade off the dog's body. I have a Shihtzu, and a Yorkie/Pomeranian mix, and it cuts through both's fur easily and smoothly, and leaves a nice finished look. I appreciate that it comes with oil. My step mom has the previous model of this one, and it is still going strong at over 13 years old. I count on mine lasting as long.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey T.G

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and gets hot
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to upgrade from my inexpensive clippers and it is extremely heavy and hurts my hand to use over time as my dog is large and very hairy. I'm very unimpressed. I did purchase the cooling spray but I have to put it on constantly so it doesn't burn my dog which greatly slows down the clipping process. I had better luck using a hand scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Great for a doodle!
customer_reviews.text: We have a doodle that we use to get groomed four times a year and each time it cost $100. Clippers for a human will not work. We tried two different types before buying these. If you have a doodle, patients, and willingness buy these and save yourself some money. The one thing I would recommend is buying two sets of blades because they get hot. Also for a doodle get the 7FC blades
customer_reviews.author: Stick fingers

customer_reviews.title: These clippers if taken care of will last a long long time.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, shaved down my 70 pound Golden Retriever in 20 minutes, came out GORGEOUS, then next day shaved down my thick coated heavy haired cat, a 12 pounder cat. Both my cat and dog look wonderful and smooth coated now. My cat took a little longer to shave, because at times she wiggled
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Radowitz

customer_reviews.title: Turns you into a professional groomer (almost)
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a groomer, just a mom to two bushy dogs with unruly hair. I have a cockapoo and a shih tzu, both of whom have different levels of separation anxiety which make it difficult to leave them at the groomers. So I've been trying to figure out how to deal with their grooming needs myself. Poor guys have suffered with bad hair cuts for years, as I've relied on scissors and never do a good job. But these clippers made it so easy! I couldn't believe how quickly and easily I could shave them down, get rid of the matts, and leave them looking halfway decent! The clippers are definitely an investment, but well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Very nice grooming clippers
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice clippers. Powerful and not real noisy. Since I am a novice, the first clip on my little long-haired chihuahua was a little choppy and closer than I wanted. After doing some research, I decided the 5FC blade might be better than the blade that came with the clippers so I purchased it and it is perfect. I have done much better with that blade and a little more practice. These clippers will pay for themselves after what I would have paid for a few grooming sessions at a pet salon. And I don't have the hassle of getting her there and picking her up.
customer_reviews.author: janniesue

customer_reviews.title: Andis fan, here.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from Andis cheaper model because we got a dog part poodle and her hair mats a lot. This clipper is just the ticket...more powerful (and strangely quieter too). I also bought the range of combs that go with it and now I can slip all three of my dogs beautifully. I also love my cheaper model, but it only worked on my other two dogs who didn't have such thick hair.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Rose

customer_reviews.title: This clipper got through the winter coats of three Great Pyrenees that work a farm
customer_reviews.text: This clipper got through the winter coats of three Great Pyrenees that work a farm ! Excellent !!!!!!!! Hard working clipper !
customer_reviews.author: SpiritGrove Farm

customer_reviews.title: Very highly recommend for thicker fur
customer_reviews.text: Wife destroyed several $40-$80 clippers from various local pet stores trying to groom her Cocker Spaniel. These clippers rock! She even used them to shave my head in about 1 minute! Is very quiet, doesnt get very hot, and goes through hair like butter.
customer_reviews.author: R. Done

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED USED CLIPPERS!
customer_reviews.text: We received this item used! It was dirty and covered in hair. I don’t expect to receive a used item when I spend $160.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Masters

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, super fast shipping. If you need to shave your dog's fur coat because they are long hair dogs and you don't want to pay the well worth it groomer charges, Look For and buy these trimmers, in your choice of many different colors. They shaved our Pomeranians hair right off, and while they look rather funny, eventually it does start to grow back. Our one pom is a different dog, more loving, sleeps on the foot of the bed now, he never did that before we shaved him. They are definitely cooler in our hot climate( which seems to be most of the US this year.
customer_reviews.author: Craigster

customer_reviews.title: Prefer these to the Oster A5 by a wide margin (golden doodle, bichon/yorkie mix, persian cat)
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to replace the Oster A5 clippers when they died (which in turn had replaced a much nicer Oster model that is no longer available, the gold colored Oster Groom Master). It takes good clippers to handle our pets--golden doodles and elderly ultra-long haired persian cats are tough on clippers, it turns out. After never really loving the A5 we decided to give these a try instead, and they're all win so far. Highlights: * they cut as well * they run cooler * they're quieter * they come with a really long cord We're super happy with them so far . . .
customer_reviews.author: Greg A.

customer_reviews.title: Great cut until broke first use
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the blue one and it broke first time using it. The power wouldn’t turn off. I do plan on ordering a replacement once my refund is issued. The clipper did cut very well before breaking. Which is why I am giving 2 stars and not one. I got half my dog (standard poodle) cut before it broke. The blade also got very hot, I suggest the blade cooling spray. After my new one gets here IF it doesn’t break I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: J.W

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Not for dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Profoundly disappointing. Barely cuts dog hair. Definitely not for poodles or any similar breed. The teeth are similar to clippers made for humans - i.e. not for animal hair. This is my second set of Andis clippers and they have lost my business.
customer_reviews.author: Alcibiades' Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Fast. Easy. Just Re-oil to Reduce Heat.
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to use. Everyone was amazed by the quality and speed at which I transformed my labradoodle - not a light job. Read instructions first though, since you will need to re-oil during extended use.
customer_reviews.author: John Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Gets hot is five minutes
customer_reviews.text: I would expect that clippers that cost $175 would be good. These get hot in five minutes....so hot that they would burn your dog. Kool Lube doesn't do the trick. I guess that they are okay, otherwise, but having to change the blade, meaning you need to buy at least 3 more blades of the same size, or spend 6 times more time waiting for them to cool. I advise you to keep looking. This product is too expensive to be such a big fail.
customer_reviews.author: Tiaramonkeybird

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the money to get good clippers like these
customer_reviews.text: We have two golden retrievers with massive amounts of hair and these work great! We went through several sets of clippers before deciding to spend the money this set. It has a long chord which makes it much easier to navigate around your dog. I’m not sure the two speeds are necessary, but I suppose it makes the clippers last longer? Both speeds work well.
customer_reviews.author: Cargo pilot

customer_reviews.title: Perfect so far!
customer_reviews.text: The number 10 cutting blade (included) cuts through my Terrier-mix breed's fur like butter. It struggles a bit more with our smaller maltese poodle, but it's still tons better than the other clippers I've tried at slightly lower price points. It gets hot to the touch after 20-30 min of continuous use, but I typically switch to scissors while I wait for it to cool off. In about five minutes, it's cool enough to trim paws and sensitive areas. Definitely recommended. Will update on durability in about 6 months.. if I remember to!
customer_reviews.author: VincentVergaraFitness

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful clippers!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 60 lb standard poodle and a 70 lb golden doodle, grooming them one time is almost 200$! I purchased these based on good reviews and a good price overall. These clippers are the BEST! We got the cool care spray, and spray every 5 minutes or so and it never overheats! We don't generally cut the body hair often but we cut their paws, faces & tail areas often and this is a life and money saver. I haven't ever had a problem with these and just use the clip ons to go with it.
customer_reviews.author: teddybear

customer_reviews.title: They run extremely hot!
customer_reviews.text: Clippers get extremely hot in a short period of time, so hot that it totally freaked my poodles out. I have never seen them so terrified! This has never happened with my Oster brand A5 clippers, that I have been using for years. I guess I was a sucker for it's gorgeous lime green color. The next time I groom my poodles, I will alternate the two clippers, so they have a chance to cool off. I will NEVER buy this brand again. I just hope my dogs aren't scarred for life!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Lee Thatcher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing clippers. Cord seems to be cheaper than in past
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always used Andis clipper; they’re phenomenal. I use them to clip horses. I was clipping a pony who step on the cord and gave 2 stops (on a rubber mat) and the cord frayed and is one wrong move away from not working. I’ve had horses dance all over these cords in the past, I’ve had them stuck under ladders or chewed on and they’ve lasted. This was my 2nd clip and the cord is likely going to be shot before long. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Brianne M Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Solid Clippers
customer_reviews.text: Used these to give my golden doodle his first hair cut when he was about 6 months old. His hair was pretty long and nappy but these clippers worked great. It took me quite a while to cut his fur the first time but since then I trim him up every few weeks and it is a breeze about 20 minutes and I am done. No issues at all very please I spend the extra few $$ to get a quality product. Even with his first cut, these seemed to cut pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Hot potato
customer_reviews.text: I read the comments before I purchased the item as well. Yes it’s true, goes through a thick coat like butter! HOWEVER, the clippers get HOT quick af. You will have to stop multiple times and use a coolant spray on the blade to quicken the process. I rate it a 4 out of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good clippers. Worked at a Vet clinic for 10 ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good clippers. Worked at a Vet clinic for 10 years these are all we used. Quiet and smooth running. As long as you use on CLEAN hair they glide through effortlessly. Dirty hair will ruin any clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would get combs
customer_reviews.text: It does heat up quickly. As someone trying to give a poodle a home haircut for the first time, I was REALLY glad I had ordered plastic combs. They helped protect my pet from the heat of the blade and meant that I did not have to worry so much about burning him. I still stopped every few minutes to clean and cool the blade, but the combs made me worry less. The clippers are very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: EDL

customer_reviews.title: get these clippers, dont get the blue plastic blade combs that amazon recommends with it though!
customer_reviews.text: quick note: if you are like me, amazon will try to recommend those blue plastic clip-on combs, but they dont fit this model. If you want to keep hair a bit longer, you want something like these: I destroyed a pair of human hair clippers on my little baby poodle before doing a little bit of research. these are amazing! shaving my little buddy down is so much faster and more enjoyable for both of us now. the clippers fly through his thick hair like its nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Peppe Gorgonzola

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed😔
customer_reviews.text: They cut beautifully, however.... they become scalding HOT after 5 minutes cutting on low. I bought 2 blades, but can't justify changing every 5 minutes. My 2nd blade is a #7, which cuts through thick hair like butter, but there again, when they get so hot after a few minutes, no way will I use them on my pets, plus no combes are made for the #7. For the price, no case, no combes, just clippers. Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: SJK-RN

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the only clippers I will use. Love their reliability.
customer_reviews.text: Have been a dedicated Andis user for my own personal animals for years. I have 2 Pekingese and a Portuguese Water Dog - this is my favorite clipper brand. I am also a veterinarian and work in many clinics doing relief work so the brands of clippers vary. Consistency is what I truly value with Andis and it has not disappointed me yet. Plus, my last set lasted me personally for OVER TEN YEARS, and they were used constantly. By “constantly” I mean every 8-12 weeks on 3 dogs. That’s pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jodi A. Holcomb

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this in 2018 for our F1b Goldendoodles. It has never worked or cut through like butter. Even after brushing and making sure she is free of mats, the clippers get stuck and do not take off her fur. I don’t know if we got a defective pair or what. We gave up after only a couple of tries and started taking her to the groomer. Well, with the current situation we got them out and cleaned them and tried again. I spent an hour cutting and there was barely any taken off. I really wanted these to work and so sad that we spent the money and wasted it.
customer_reviews.author: Landis Herrin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and quiet for cats
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to trim down hair on our Maine Coon cat. His fur is dry and constantly matting in several areas on his body. It was frustrating him and he was digging at it all the time. Anyway, it runs very quietly. He was not bothered by it al all. Trimmed him down beautifully, added a thick conditioner and in a week fluffy soft fur with no more mats!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela S. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: We have an older dog that the Pet Smart Groomer suddenly decided was too old to be groomed. It was obvious they had no idea about the actual dog breed as well. So my husband purchased these as he has wiry soft hair that a typical set of cutters had difficulty cutting. These worked great and he looks even better then he did when ‘professionals’ cut him!
customer_reviews.author: Chattygal

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These work on my two dogs (shih-tzu and shih-tzu mix) with tons of hair. I was paying $120 every 3-4 months for the dogs and this saved me a ton! it does take practice to make the dogs look good - but whatever. They aren't in any competitions, so its fine, We tried human hair clippers and that was a mess- great for doggies!
customer_reviews.author: sandhog

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Friendly Clipper
customer_reviews.text: This was my second Andis clipper that I have purchased. I bought it due to the fact the first one the motor burned out. I have approximately 10 sets of clipper blades that fit that clipper so I purchased the same model clipper in lieu of purchasing a different clipper and throwing the (10) plus sets of blades away. The new clipper got very hot during the first use. I am concerned it will not last. I was clipping a small Corgi and the new clipper got very hot so I let it cool for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Big Red

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with these clippers
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these clippers. For a 1st time user, I think I did a particularly fine job on my 60lb labradoodle. I ordered a different size blade, which was very easy to change out. These clippers were surprisingly very quiet, which I was concerned about seeing as though this was only her second time being trimmed. The blade got warm, but never hot. I used it on the low speed the entire time & had no problem cutting through her coarse hair. Definitely would recommend these clippers!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Miller

customer_reviews.title: Pay more get more! Don’t be cheap!Well worth money!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it is to shave my little Schnauzer mix without my hand hurting from chasing the dog running away from my previous clippers I had!My advice, if you’re looking to buy it is to buy itnow not 6 clippers later like I did! I kept buying cheap ones! Well deserved investment!
customer_reviews.author: kokolino

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with these clippers. After using them twice, we had paid for them, considering what we pay the groomer. I use the # 10 blade and 3/8th attachment ( purchased separately) on our little cavapoo.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Moyers

customer_reviews.title: Work AMAZING but they overheat quickly
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other reviews. It slices like butter but it overheats quickly. Small price to pay for how well it cuts. I tried cutting out golden doodle's hair with $50 andis clippers and it took about 20 minutes to cut an area with a 3" radius. It was a nightmare. These clippers work SO MUCH BETTER. With thick coats, mats, you name it, these will work. It only takes about 10 minutes before they get too hot though... :/
customer_reviews.author: mzingraf

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this clipper
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this clipper; however, wish it had come in a case. I initially saw this clipper at Petco and it was in a protective case. Other than that, I'm glad I purchased this clipper as it works well on my Scottish Terrier and Poodle. It is POWERFUL and QUIET.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought the blades I needed for my dogs and was good to go
customer_reviews.text: I've got Schnauzers, so they grow hair - don't shed and need trimming every month. This has made my dog upkeep much simpler and cheaper. Bought the blades I needed for my dogs and was good to go. **One caution is the blades do get hot when you're using them, so don't use it for too long or you could burn your dog in the more sensitive areas like the ears and underbelly. I just swap from one blade to the other when they warm up and that seems to work for me.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Blade over heated very quickly, doesnt have much "oomph".
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this clipper having had an Andis for many years in the past. Unfortunately, it was quite disappointing: the blade overheated within five minutes and I was not using it on a matted coat, just around the hind quarters of an Airedale. In addition, the "high speed" just doesn't seem to have any "oomph". Perhaps it is better suited for smaller breed dogs with very fine coats, but for my dog it just didn't fly. Guess I'll give Oster a shot... .
customer_reviews.author: S.H. M.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Work perfectly with my skiddish Maltipoo. Relatively quiet, very sharp. I'd been cheap in the past paying $30-40 on clippers and always disappointed. I'd recommend these to anyone that needs to trim often. These are the same clippers that are used by Petco groomers.
customer_reviews.author: bradley m barrick

customer_reviews.title: Quiet clippers do not scare my dog.
customer_reviews.text: These clippers work really well, and zip through the hair of my shih tzu / Pomeranian mix dog. He was very frightened of the noise that a cheaper clipper made. Just be aware that the metal clipper blade heats up pretty quickly and can burn your dog if you are not careful. I keep a gel ice pack on hand to quickly cool the clippers and keep on trimming.
customer_reviews.author: LoveEndless

customer_reviews.title: Blade rusty!
customer_reviews.text: The blade (#10) the came with it looks like it is rusty. I didn’t notice it when I got it the 16th January but had ordered another blade (#7) which arrived yesterday and when changing the blade out there it was. Haven’t even used it yet so very disappointed as it is not cheap and only comes with the #10 blade. This doesn’t seem right at all...why would it be rusty already?
customer_reviews.author: M Grace

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Clippers for groomers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for any self taught dog groomer. My labradoodle has a heavy coat and it shears his fur with no issues. I highly recommend spending the money on these if your dog has a double, tough, or thick coat. I would also recommend buying the cooling spray to avoid agitation of the dog's skin due to overheating blade.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmers ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best trimmer I’ve ever used! I have a Black Russian Terrier, and I’ve always had trouble shaving her down. This razor shaves her down like a knife cutting through butter!! The blades barely heat up! I’d highly recommend this trimmer. I used the #5 FC Blades for most of her body, and the #10 on her ears and neck. All of them cut great!
customer_reviews.author: BRT 1

customer_reviews.title: Changing blade is a huge chore...
customer_reviews.text: I chose this clipper as I understood it had a detachable blade. It didn't. Changing the blade is a terrible chore that requires screwdrivers and frankly, an engineering degree. It runs wonderfully and is very lightweight, but changing the blade and trying to read the instructions are extremely onerous. I'm very disappointed. I used it once, and changing the blade was such a chore that I haven't used it again. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: KarenG

customer_reviews.title: Love this produce.
customer_reviews.text: I love these Clippers. I have two poodles with very thick curly hair. I've tried other Clippers that would not go through the hair as well. I really like the ceramic blade. It really does a great job. I've used the combs that come sepatetly. They are terrific. I've had a wonderful response from customer service. Try them on your dog. You will be a big fan as I am. . They go through their hair so well. wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Moore

customer_reviews.title: Decided to buy after spending weeks researching different clipper models ...
customer_reviews.text: Decided to buy after spending weeks researching different clipper models. It barely cut through my cockapoo's hair so I had to return. It also got incredibly hot after a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A West

customer_reviews.title: Quite satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Saving us tons of money. We watched many videos grooming dogs. I looked up reviews on clippers and this one kept coming up number one. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Hughbanks

customer_reviews.title: Great set of clippers
customer_reviews.text: This a great average set of clippers. They get through moderately matted/pelted fur, but won't make the job easier if it's severely pelted. The cord has kind of been wonky in the past month or so, clippers will stutter, but turning them off and back on always fixes the problem. Not super light, but on the heavier side, but not enough to make my hand or arm tired.
customer_reviews.author: Becky M Stahlecker

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The Ultra Edge 3 speed trimmer is well made, very solid, and runs quite. The 2 speed function is nice; I generally use the high speed for grooming and the low speed when changing blades and trimming around the ears. I like the fact that I can use different style of cutting heads without having to use combs.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Heats up WAY TOO QUICK! In minutes!
customer_reviews.text: Today was the first time I used these since I received them. Shaves great but it heats up WAY TOO QUICK! Every two minutes at most, I had to stop to cool it down with a coolant. Thankfully I only had to groom one dog. I spent this amount of money just for the job to take just as long as using a cheaper buzzer because I have to stop so many times throughout the process of completing one small dog.
customer_reviews.author: Yaboikalanz

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed with this clipper
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try grooming my two dogs in between their professional grooming appointments as a way of saving some money. I have a goldendoodle and a labradoodle. At first I purchased the Wahl 9590-210. That clipper worked quite well. I thought it would be a benefit to add another clipper and so after much online research I purchased this Andis UltraEdge AGC Super 2 speed. This clipper does not cut my dogs hair. I had also purchased an additional blade so I tried that and it doesn't make a difference. Not sure if I got a detective clipper or what but I would not purchase this again and I would not recommend this clipper.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful clippers, well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful clippers for my golden chow mix who had some mats. Cuts through thick hair easily. Well worth the investment considering the time money and stress of taking him to the groomer. Dog also seems to love it...no discomfort and not bothered by any noise. They do get a little warm, but we take breaks anyway. Still well worth it for how well they work.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: Love my Andis
customer_reviews.text: Have 5 little dogs that I groom and these clippers are great. My previous Andis clipper was over 10 years old when it recently died so it was no question that I would purchase another of the same make and model.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: Item is kinda on the heavy side. I have arthritis in hands and fingers and hands get sore holding it. Overall, it cuts my Shi-poo's hair easily. It gets pretty warm and may burn pet. I have tried numerous other clippers and nothing would cut my pets hair. This product has saved me countless hours.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Solid and well made. Very pleased. I am not a professional ...... I keep my Springer Spaniel trimmed year round..and this product works well.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price and then some!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic clippers!! Whether doing a cat or dog, long hair, short, it doesn't matter. These suckers cut like a hot knife through buttah! Quiet, so they don't upset the animal, I would recommend these to anyone looking to groom, even if you've never done it before. Easy for beginners, great for experts.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had gotten this sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great clipper for a thick coated, long haired dog. I used this clipper on my Pomeranian and it cut the fur like a hot knife through butter. The blade didn't get clogged with hair/fur. It is a pretty quiet clipper that didn't upset my dog when using it on him. I sure wish I had purchased this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Schnoodle approved!
customer_reviews.text: We finally invested in a good pair of clippers for grooming our 2 Schnoodle who have curly thick coats. We have gone through a couple pairs of clippers that were from the pet store and they would get ruined but these seem like they will definitely last! The first time we used them we couldn’t believe how easy they cut this wild hair. Honestly our grooming time was cut in half probably even more ! Definitely recommend with a couple size different blades.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on both of my dogs. It was a big job because they are both around 80 lbs with long hair. Easy to use. Only thing is to keep checking the metal piece (on bottom) to make sure it is not getting too hot and burning the dog's just shaved skin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for pet grooming
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews for clippers for pet grooming, I chose these when I saw professional pet groomers use them. They are vastly better than cheap clippers. They make quick work of thick pet hair. They make minimal sound so as not to scare pets.
customer_reviews.author: kayla croce-hunt

customer_reviews.title: Works so good!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to shave my Bouvier Des Flanders who has super thick hair. Even though it has a wire, it is so easy to use and because the blades cut well I can groom quick. My fur baby HATES being groomed so grooming quick is a necessity. Cuts clean and fast. It does get a little warm, but nothing that burns or hurts when using
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST clippers!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a great investment these were!! My springer spaniel has cancer. As a result open sores meant she couldn't go to the groomer. She was way, way over due for a shave down. These clippers worked like a dream!!!! Yes, like all clippers, they heat up. We simply waited for them to cool down to continue each section until she was done. I highly recommend these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M. Ivins

customer_reviews.title: ... bought because most of the reviews seemed to be good, but it does get hot fast and I've ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought because most of the reviews seemed to be good, but it does get hot fast and I've had better. I have to keep switching the blades because they get hot so fast, and I'm constantly adjusting the blade guide when installing a different blade, because the blades didn't seem to fit at first, I was worried at first that I bought the wrong blades. I'm a bit disappointed because but will continues to use.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Started making loud noise after one and a half cuts.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this pet clipper around August 15,2019. I just started my second trim on my small dog and when I was about half way through the clipper started making a loud noise. I had already stopped to clean the hair off the blades and give it a small amount of oil and was wondering what could be wrong. I was going to return it but when I looked at my invoice the window for returning it was Sept 14th. I'm so disappointed and my husband is furious .
customer_reviews.author: Victoria D.

customer_reviews.title: Great clippers
customer_reviews.text: My dog runs when I come at her with the scissors but she just lays there when i use these clippers -- she did that at the groomers the last time she went. She is getting old (11 1/2 @ 85 pounds) so she deserves to do what she wants to. I just do whichever side is up...
customer_reviews.author: Barb the Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the long cord. Gets in the way. It’s a nice product tho
customer_reviews.text: The blade gets hot in ten minutes. The cord is almost too long. I bought added attachment blades. The buzz is not as loud as others. I didn’t oil the first blade and it became dull. My fault- now I oil. I’ve given 3 dogs about 10 haircuts and the buzzer is a year old and still running. Just oil your blades!
customer_reviews.author: deborah daunders

customer_reviews.title: I've used clippers since 1968 and these take the honors of worst ever encountered
customer_reviews.text: Within its first 2 minutes, after lubricating the blade and beginning operation it was too hot to touch and was making my dog recoil from the heat. I'm returning to my 10 yr old Oster Turbo A5 clipper.It may be slow but no one loses skin. I've used clippers since 1968 and these take the honors of worst ever encountered. BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hamre

customer_reviews.title: it is very easy to use and gentle on the cat
customer_reviews.text: it is very easy to use and gentle on the cat. it was our first time trying to use a shaver on our cat, and she came out beautifully. the only thing is it heats up and our cat jumps from time to time because of it. I am very glad we bought a spare blade to switch around. We probably switched about 7 times during the cut.
customer_reviews.author: Ideafine

customer_reviews.title: Worth their weight in gold
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually leave reviews but we splurged on these clippers for our two doodles, we have a sheepadoodle and goldendoodle. These clippers worked amazingly well for both pups. Well worth the money if you’re trying to trim your dogs yourself during these Covid times.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Very good clipper for your pets.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good clipper. Bought to replace my old andis clipper that I had for 8 years, it works but it half clips and brushes my poodles hair at the same time. I tried fixing it but what do I know? Back to the UltraEdge, works well. I love that it has two speeds even though my poodle was fine with the slower speed. It does heat up, I can honestly say I've never used a clipper that doesn't heat up. My only concern is that I ordered the green clippers but received blue clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I am SO disappointed with this clipper. The safety red button is defective and slips out so it is impossible to keep the clipper on without physically holing it in place. This isn't possible when clipping a dog!! I would like a replacement product please.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew webber

customer_reviews.title: Sweet cut
customer_reviews.text: Had a Wahl before this and did not cut as well as this Andis. Love the 2 speed. I save a lot of money not going to the groomer. Love!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy-Sue

customer_reviews.title: Best dog clippers for thick coats
customer_reviews.text: Amazing dog clippers! We have a Wheaten Terrier/Chow mix that is very difficult to groom. Her fur is very thick and mats very easily. These clippers are expensive but well worth it. We have bought 3-4 pairs of $40-50 dog clippers that barely worked for a couple cuts before they stopped cutting completely and wish we had bought these a long time ago. They are easy to use and our dog actually cooperates with us when we groom her now.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: First pair I ordered were SUPER loud and vibrated a lot, I knew how it was supposed to sound because my other 3 co-workers all groom with this pair of clippers, so I contacted support for them and they sent me out a replacement pair and I'm sending the old pair back. The new pair sounds and works great. 4 star because the first pair wasn't great.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Best clippers
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have to shave down my pomeranians. They can't stand all that hair in this Texas heat. This is the 3rd clipper I have purchased, but this brand is the best by far.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Elvir

customer_reviews.title: best clippers ever
customer_reviews.text: best clippers ever!!! well worth the money. my dog is a golden doodle and I have gone through so many clippers that didn't work and jammed. these really got the job done and it saved me $100 just with one cut because I have a 90 lb golden doodle and that's how much they charge me in my area
customer_reviews.author: adriana meilhammer

customer_reviews.title: as i have read the reviews and they seem good i payed 150 for this razor and I'm very ...
customer_reviews.text: i bought this product last June and i have only used it 4 tines every time i use it it gets hot after 2 minutes and i have to wait till it cools off i don't think this is normal, as i have read the reviews and they seem good i payed 150 for this razor and I'm very disappointed. And since its been a year I'm sure i can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for home use for a standard poodle ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for home use for a standard poodle. It gets very hot after 10 minutes of use. Works very well other then that.
customer_reviews.author: IJ

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool!
customer_reviews.text: We use on our terrier. Have been through a couple of clippers and overheating was really a problem on the dogs tough coat. These are the best we have used so far, no doubt. Worth the money, especially if you think about how much it costs for grooming.
customer_reviews.author: Golden-gator

customer_reviews.title: Andis clippers rock!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been attempting to cut my Westie’s hair with Wahl clippers for the last several years and it was a beat down. You’d get 3-4 inches down a pass and the clippers jam up with hair. The Andis clippers make full passes and cut perfectly. Worth the $180 as that is 3 trips to the groomer. After my 1st cut with these clippers, my wife said her cut looked like a pro cut her hair. Buy the cutting guides and a case to round out the package.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good for Pek-a-poo's
customer_reviews.text: I have several puppydogs, I know it isn't a real word but that is how I describe my little family. I have one but needed another as it does get hot fairly soon but my dogs do have quite a bit of hair. It is quiet easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bec

product_meta.title: Andis UltraEdge Super 2-Speed Detachable Blade Clipper, Professional Animal/Dog Grooming, AGC2
product_meta.description: Color:Burgundy| Style:Frustration Free PackagingAndis ProClip Super 2-Speed Detachable Blade Clipper, Professional Animal Grooming, AGC2
feature_bullets: Cool and quiet running , Volts - 120 V
Perfect for all coats and breeds.
Detachable blade design for ease of changing and cleaning.
Super two-speed rotary motor for performance that pros demand.
14' heavy-duty cord for ease of movement around animals and equipment.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
